instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
I  flash BIOS but not fixed. 
mac working ,charging  and responsible to REST SMC via keyboard
I have other same mac and test to swap lcd bot no display.
please what is yours suggestion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
SMC reset is hardware implemented.
If SMC is up and running, doesn't mean the board is working!!!
CPU is not involved in this process.

Do you get all needed voltages on the board?
Is VCORE present?

Did you test for USB activity?

Be aware, ALL <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machines end with dead CPU.
You may waste your time with this...
